request.description: Provides a summary of all connected app visors.

response.name: /api/visors

request.description: Provides a summary of a given connected app node of public key.
Provides a summary of an AppNode's apps.
Starts an app on an AppNode.

Starts an app on a visor.It accepts a json body like the one in the example. status can take values 0 or 1. If 0 the hypervisor will stop such app in the visor, if 1 it will start it. A visor can only start apps that are defined in it's configuration file. The app name provided here should be the same that is defined in the visor's config file.
Lists supported transport types of the given AppNode.
Adds a transport to a given AppNode.
Obtains summary of transport of given TransportID and AppNode.
Removes transport of given TransportID and AppNode.

header.value: swm-session=MTU2NjkxNjE0N3xRZUlIRXpMRGwzWlNwNE01QzE0WnAxd3ZEb3pvNEZLSEhCYjd0eWI4dzZhWFEzWHRTUTdRQkVyTUI5cHVoOExGX0ttODJfMWF8AIoAT1RkzoPxb38uTg67eDdz26QqWIdvM_9lEXWCt8Q=; Expires=Wed, 28 Aug 2019 02:29:07 GMT; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite

request.description: Provides given node's uptime in seconds
Returns health information about the requested visor

Returns given app's logs in given node since given timestamp. The given timestamp log is not included in the results.

For optimal performance, the last request's timestamp should be used in the next request as value for since.

If there is an error in the timestamp format or since is empty all the logs from the beginning will be returned.
Returns a map of rule entries that compose the requested node routing rules
Adds a new routing rule. Can be either a forward rule or an app rule. Rule type 0 is app type, rule type 1 is forward type.
Returns information of rule of given route id. Route ids are displayed on a successful `GET /api/visors/{pk}/routes`
Puts routing rule entry on given route id with the given routing rule provided in the body as json. If an existing route id is used it replaces the previous entry at such id.
Deletes the routing rule of the provided route id
Returns availabe loops on the visor.
